game_description: WIN Reality has been upgraded to the Meta Quest Store! Search for WIN Reality in your headset to download. Using your existing login information will get you back to the plate. _________________________________________________ Practice like the pros with WIN Reality's fully-immersive VR baseball and softball training system. WIN Reality lets hitters of all skill levels step into a batter's box anytime, anywhere to see unlimited game-speed pitches. Improve your pitch recognition, timing, and plate discipline with ten training drills designed by pro players. Track performance data and get individual coaching and training plans to take your game to the next level. TRAINING MODES AND FULL FEATURES INCLUDE: - Optional bat attachment - bring your bat into VR - Access to 1-on-1 coaching - Full Batting Practice - Pitch Recognition - Situational Hitting - Library of 600+ pitchers for all velocities, arm angles, and pitch types - Performance tracking and feedback - Customized training plans
review_2: This is a great visual tool for hitters. Helps learn the zone and see the ball from the pitchers hand quickly.
review_3: Love this so much, it has really helped me with my swing, love all of the drills, use it everyday. But I think it would be really cool if you could play actual games. You could have a campaign mode where you draft players for your team and try to win the World Series. You only do offense, defense is simulated.
review_4: It looks pretty fun and very helpful, but I dont understand why I need a membership. I have been doing pretty bad at getting on base and I’m just a 12 year old. Also I don’t know why it’s 19 dollars a month either, it would be better just to make it permanent or just maybe free
review_5: The price point on a membership for this game is absolutely insane at over $200 for a year. Not to mention that you cannot even do anything in the app if you don’t have a membership. My word to the developers or company, add a free account with a certain amount of pitches per day just to get people started. Your $20 a month membership fee is turning people like me (who could be loyal customers if you give us a try) away the minute we download the app. Or just add a flat cost to download the game, because that might be reasonable as well
